results.title: Sneakers
results.creator_credit: Phil Alden Robinson, Lindsley Lindsley Parsons, Walter Parkes, Lawrence Lasker and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Martin Bishop heads an organisation of computer hackers, technology experts, reformed thieves and outsiders who are paid to break into high-security institutions in order to prove their vulnerability. Several shady characters approach Martin to steal an electronic code-breaker that is a risk to national security. Against his instincts Martin accepts the assignment when they threaten to expose his true identity. Naturally nothing goes to plan, and the friends find themselves in peril when they realise the decoder’s awesome potential for destruction. What transpires is a thriller entailing conspiracy theories, double-crossings, a corrupt government and murder. “Sneakers” is quite amusing and, at times, somewhat fraught with tension, as the team battle a myriad of forces. Pre-dating the late 1990s, early 2000s paranoid computer-hacker films, “Sneakers” has a sprightliness that impresses and despite an overabundance of contrivances, makes for a satisfying caper. Top cast includes Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier, Ben Kingsley, Dan Ackroyd, Mary McDonnell, River Phoenix and David Strathairn.

results.title: Snatch [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Guy Ritchie, Matthew Vaughn and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Guy Ritchie’s second feature follows on seamlessly from his first: the music video/caper movie, “Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels”. It’s cast - peppered with Hollywood stars Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina and Brad Pitt - portray a crowd of London small-timers torturing, mutilating and wise-cracking their way across Ritchie’s home territory: ludicrous plots, racial stereotypes and groovy pop music, all in the name of derisively good fun. If “Lock, Stock” was an escapade into guilt-free sick violence, then “Snatch” is exactly the same.

results.title: Snapshot = Day after Halloween = Day before Halloween [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Antony Ginnane, William Fayman, Barbi Taylor and Australian International Film Corporation
results.brief_description: For his film debut director Simon Wincer chose to tread the well-chartered territory of the horror thriller, in which the life for an innocent character is irretrievably changed through a combination of naivety and bad encounters. Angela, a young hairdresser with modelling ambitions, is talked into posing nude for a photo in order to attract attention. Soon enough, the attention is transformed in stalking, complete with the discovery of a pig’s head in her bed. Of the sleazy producer, the eccentric magazine producer and the clingy ex-boyfriend — who wants Angela dead and why? Reference: Greg Kerr ‘Australian Film’ (Scott Murray ed.) Oxford University Press, 1995: p. 47.

images.caption: Snapshot = Day after Halloween = Day before Halloween  (Simon Wincer) still

results.title: Snapshot = Day after Halloween = Day before Halloween  [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Antony Ginnane, AIFC and William Fayman
results.brief_description: Sigrid Thornton stars in this dramatic thriller as Angela, a young hairdresser who has just split up with her boyfriend Daryl (Vincent Gil). Daryl is obsessed by Angela and can’t move on after their break-up and follows her around in his “Mr Whippy” van. Upon meeting the exotic and glamorous Madeline (Chantal Contouri) Angela gives up hairdressing to try out as a model in glamour photography. Her first shoot is a topless one and suddenly she becomes very popular - the quick fame and money is a case of too much too soon and her youth and inexperience lead Angela to be manipulated. Tensions also rise as she becomes victim to an anonymous stalker. With music by Brian May, two songs performed by Sherbet and shot on location in Melbourne, this is also a snapshot of the city in the late 1970s. Released in the United States as “The Day before Halloween”. Note: the quality of the transfer to DVD is low. Cast includes Denise Drysdale, Robert Bruning, Julia Blake, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Bob Brown.

results.title: Snakes and ladders
results.creator_credit: Trish FitzSimons, Mitzi Goldman and Wisteria Films
results.brief_description: An experimental documentary which looks at the history of women and their education through a series of film clips, old footage, animation and interviews. Sophia Whist is a character on a journey of enquiry. She discovers an old book in the public library which comes alive. In its pages she meets ten women between the ages of 16 and 94, who talk about their education. Their stories are about wanting an education, wanting more from their education, fighting to extend their options, and demanding to be taught material that incorporates the experience of women. They reveal how women’s achievements in one generation are often hidden in the next making it difficult for women to draw on the wealth of knowledge and experience of their predecessors. Cast: Robin Laurie.

results.title: Snakes and how they live
results.brief_description: Relates major pertinent concepts about snakes, using a great variety of types to show how they move, eat, shed skin, etc. An open-ended approach stimulates class discussion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snake eyes
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Touchstone and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a high profile boxing match, gaudy casino and an immanent hurricane, this essentially interior crime thriller centres around 2 friends and law enforcement agents, one of whom may or may not be corrupt. Detective Ray Santoro (Nicolas Cage) is an Atlantic City cop, willing to take a bribe, dreaming of being on television, and always getting results. He meets his long time friend, Navy Commander Kevin Dunne (Gary Sinise), ringside, at a heavyweight bought signalling the swan song of the Atlantic City arena, where they, along with thousands of spectators witness the political assassination of the U.S Secretary of Defence. The stadium is shut down as Santoro leads the investigation, searching for a mysterious woman (Carla Gugion) seen speaking to the secretary shortly before he was killed. Dunne, meanwhile, is taking credit for locating the shooter, a Palestinian fall guy. As Santoro finds his witness, he learns of a conspiracy involving the Norfolk testing and learns the shocking truth about his friend. With state of the art surveillance equipment in the stadium, all eyes are watching proceeding and nothing can escape detection. When the truth is finally revealed, Santoro is forced to question his loyalty to Dunne, and whether he will live up to his reputation as a corrupt cop. Cast also includes John Heard, Stan Shaw and Michael Rispoli.

results.title: Snake bite
results.brief_description: An interactive war game set in Iraq. You are a soldier and your mission is to intercept a rebel force planning an attack on Al Hilhah, south of Baghdad, and destroy this terrorist threat before they are able to kill any of the city’s civilians.
